## ESPAD vs RAPI

When conducting research in psychology and social sciences, comparing different questionnaires such as ESPAD and RAPI can be crucial. While ESPAD primarily focuses on tobacco use among students, RAPI is an in-depth tool that explores issues relating to alcohol use. Interestingly, the harmonisation of these two types of questionnaires can offer valuable insights into youth substance use behaviour. Harmony, a groundbreaking software tool, supports psychologists in making this comparison, simplifying the process of harmonisation with its innovative AI capabilities.

## Compare the items in ESPAD and RAPI

## Why choose Harmony for ESPAD vs RAPI?


Harmony uses advanced natural language processing and generative AI models to harmonise questionnaire items, even across different languages. For an ESPAD vs RAPI comparison, Harmony systematically compares the items in both instruments and provides a percentage match. The time-consuming and subjective process of manually going through PDFs and inputting data in Excel is virtually eliminated, allowing you to focus more on the analysis and interpretation of the data.

## Maximise the power of ESPAD vs RAPI with Harmony

In the quest to derive meaningful insights from social science research, it's paramount to make the most of cohort and longitudinal studies. Using Harmony to compare ESPAD vs RAPI empowers psychologists to validate whether results are reliable across diverse studies, or if they fluctuate in response to varying social scenarios. The software's extensive database offers ample options for instrument selection, and if you have your own, Harmony allows you to quickly upload them in PDF form via its user-friendly web interface. Tap into the potential of ESPAD vs RAPI with Harmony today.
